definition: very beautiful and delicate
example: Look at this exquisite painting.

definition: (of an animal) eating plants
example: Rabbits are relatively large, wild, herbivorous mammals.

definition: an animal with no spine
example: Invertebrates, such as worms, are the main diet of these water birds.

definition: essentially different in kind; not allowing comparison
example: They inhabit disparate worlds of thought.

meaning_cn: 易于遭受（疾病）的，有（消极）倾向的
definition: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
example: He was prone to depression even as a teenager.

definition: If a feeling or the effect of something wears off, it gradually disappears.
example: Most patients find that the numbness from the injection wears off after about an hour.

definition: having the qualities that you expect a particular type of person to have
example: Customers are tired of the stereotypical, fast-talking salesperson.

definition: nearly; almost
example: Their twins are virtually identical.

definition: situated within or inside; relating to the inside; inner
example: The interior lighting is not adequate.

definition: designed to be useful rather than decorative
example: Like many factories, it's a very ugly utilitarian building.

meaning_cn: 消耗，耗费（资源、金钱、精力等）
definition: to reduce something in size or amount, especially supplies of energy, money, etc.
example: If we continue to deplete the earth's natural resources, we will cause serious damage to the environment.

meaning_cn: （因充分发挥自己的才能而）心满意足的，得偿所愿的
definition: satisfied or happy because of fully developing one's abilities or character
example: Now that I have my dream job, for the first time in my life I feel really fulfilled.

definition: to be greater or more important than something else
example: The benefits of this treatment far outweigh any risks.

meaning_cn: 包含，藏有（细菌等）；心怀，怀有（想法或感情）
definition: 1. to contain the bacteria, etc. that can cause a disease to spread; 2. to think about or feel something, usually over a long period
example: He's been harbouring a grudge against her ever since his promotion was refused.

definition: to find the position of something
example: Electricians worked through the night to localize the faulty switches.

definition: a difference between two things that should be the same
example: There is some discrepancy between the two accounts.

meaning_cn: （事实或想法）令人不快的，让人难以接受的
definition: an unpalatable fact or idea is very unpleasant and difficult to accept
example: The unpalatable truth is that the team isn't getting any better.

definition: to destroy someone or something completely
example: The human race has enough weapons to annihilate itself.

definition: a tool that is used in the house
example: Utensils are tools or objects that you use in order to help you to cook, serve food, or eat.

definition: to break open so that a young bird, fish, insect, etc. can come out
example: The eggs are about to hatch.

definition: an insect at the stage when it has just come out of an egg and looks like a short fat worm
example: The eggs quickly hatch into larvae.

definition: (especially of a word, phrase, etc.) unnecessary because it is more than is needed
example: In the sentence "She is a single unmarried woman", the word "unmarried" is redundant.

definition: a strong feeling of affection for someone or something
example: As a teenager she formed a strong attachment to one of her teachers.

meaning_cn: 恶兆的，不祥的，不吉利的
definition: suggesting that something unpleasant is likely to happen
example: There was an ominous silence when I asked whether my contract was going to be renewed.

definition: feeling happy and also slightly sad when you think about things that happened in the past
example: Talking about our old family holidays has made me feel all nostalgic.

definition: not having enough of a specified quality or ingredient
example: This diet is deficient in vitamin B.

definition: work extremely hard or incessantly
example: Richard toiled to build his editorial team.

definition: critical observation or examination
example: Every aspect of local government was placed under scrutiny.

definition: a remark that expresses praise or admiration of someone; to tell someone that you like or admire something they have done
example: She complimented him on his excellent German.

definition: a thing that adds new qualities to something in a way that improves it; to add to something in a way that improves it
example: The team needs players who complement each other.

meaning_cn: 促成，加速…的发生；（使）沉淀
definition: 1. to make something happen suddenly or sooner than expected; 2. If a liquid precipitates, substances in it become solid and separate from the liquid.
example: An invasion would certainly precipitate a political crisis.

definition: to collect something, especially in large quantities
example: He amassed a fortune from silver mining.

meaning_cn: 生物量（以生境面积或容积表示）
definition: the total quantity or weight of plants and animals in a particular area or volume
consisting of two parts
example: Human sexuality is more complicated than the simple binary of "homosexuals" and "heterosexuals."

definition: a short, pithy statement expressing a general truth or rule of conduct
example: Do not forget the maxim that actions speak louder than words.

definition: the way that someone looks or behaves
example: He maintained a professional demeanour throughout.

definition: a lack of interest, feeling or reaction towards someone or something
very informal words and expressions that are more common in spoken language, especially used by a particular group of people
example: Archie liked to think he kept up with current slang.

definition: a feeling of anger or unhappiness about something that you think is unfair
example: She could not conceal the deep resentment she felt at the way she had been treated.

definition: ready to conform to the authority or will of others; meekly obedient or passive
example: He was looking for a quiet, submissive wife who would obey his every word.

definition: receive (money, property, or a title) as an heir at the death of the previous holder
example: She inherited a fortune from her father.

definition: move in a twisting or spiralling pattern
example: The smoke was swirling around him.

definition: make (something) impure by exposure to or addition of a poisonous or polluting substance
example: The site was found to be contaminated by radioactivity.

meaning_cn: 尽职履行（责任），尽职完成（任务）
definition: do all that is required to fulfill (a responsibility) or perform (a duty)
example: The city must discharge its legal duty to house the homeless.
